posts.cooked: Modules make a much smaller impact compared to motors and coding. The next most important consideration is whether you’ve read the manual and applied locktite and grease where necessary. In my humble opinion, while these things may be pricey, the easiest way to achieve a controlled, low-battery-consuming drive is to use CTre motors on both drive and steer, along with a Pigeon 2, Canine, and a Pro_license. Additionally, pairing a CTre Swerve generator with an Advantage Kit Sketch often yields better results. After testing every combination of WCP, REV, and SDS motors—along with REV and CTre motors alone—and even going as far as using Kraken motors on all units, the experience was significantly smoother.
